ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Does your baby ever cry uncontrollably for no reason, even though they are well-fed?
Notes: 0= No, 1= Yes, 999 = I Decline to Answer

ElementDescription: When you baby cries uncontrollably, how long does the crying generally last?
Notes: 1= Less than 3 hours, 2= 3 hours or more, 999= I Decline to Answer

ElementDescription: In the last week, how often has your baby had periods of uncontrollable crying that lasted more than 3 hours?
Notes: 1= Never, 2= Less than 3 days of the week, 3 = More than 3 days of the week, 999= I Decline to Answer

ElementDescription: In the morning (6am-noon), approximately how many hours and minutes total is your baby typically crying or fussing?
In the afternoon (noon-6pm), approximately how many hours and minutes total is your baby typically crying or fussing?
In the evening (6pm-midnight), approximately how many hours and minutes total is your baby typically crying or fussing?
Overnight (midnight - 6am), approximately how many hours and minutes total is your baby typically crying or fussing?
Does the amount of fussing and crying vary from day to day?
Notes: 1= Not at all, 2= A little, 3= Much, 4= Very much, 999= I Decline to Answer

ElementDescription: How often your baby fusses or cries in general?
Notes: 1= Not at all, 2= A little, 3= Much, 4= Very much, 999= I Decline to Answer

ElementDescription: Has your baby's fussing and crying been of enough concern to involve your pediatrician?
Notes: 1= Not at all, 2= A little, 3= Much, 4= Very much, 999= I Decline to Answer
